item.title: US Supreme Court poised to strike down abortion rights, leaked draft suggests
item.description: The Supreme Court may be poised to strike down the right to abortion in the United States, US media reported Monday, citing a leaked draft of a majority opinion that would represent a staggering blow to women’s rights.
item.source: Getty Images via AFP - ANNA MONEYMAKER
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: France’s conservatives torn over Macron’s ‘siren call’ before parliamentary polls
item.description: France’s traditional conservative party Les Républicains (LR) was humiliated in last month’s presidential elections, squeezed between the biggest voting blocs on the centre right and far right. Now LR’s leading figures are rowing over the prospect of joining forces with Emmanuel Macron as the president is expected to maintain his majority in June’s parliamentary vote.
item.dc:creator: Tom WHEELDON

item.title: Live: EU prepares for showdown with Russia over oil and gas
item.description: The European Union warned member states Monday to prepare for a possible complete breakdown in gas supplies from Russia, insisting it would not cede to Moscow's demand that imports be paid for in rubles. Follow FRANCE 24’s liveblog for all the latest developments. All times are Paris time (GMT+2).
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Tunisia announces 'national dialogue', excluding opposition groups
item.description: Tunisian President Kais Saied has announced the launch of "national dialogue" to help resolve a political crisis following his controversial power grab, but excluding critical opposition groups.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Mali junta breaks off from defence accords with France
item.description: Mali’s ruling junta announced on Monday it was breaking off from its defence accords with former colonial ruler France, condemning “flagrant violations” of its national sovereignty by the French troops there.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: French Greens, leftist Mélenchon form alliance ahead of parliamentary elections
item.description: Momentum was building on Monday behind attempts by French left-wing parties to form a united front against President Emmanuel Macron in next month's parliamentary elections, after radical Jean-Luc Mélenchon clinched a deal with the Greens.
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Spanish PM’s mobile phone infected by Pegasus malware
item.description: The cellphones of Spain's prime minister and defense minister were infected last year with Pegasus spyware, which is available only to countries' government agencies, authorities announced Monday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Civilians attempt evacuation from Ukraine’s besieged Mariupol
item.description: Ukrainian authorities attempted further evacuations from Mariupol on Monday, following an initial operation to remove around 100 civilians from the besieged Azovstal steel plant. Meanwhile, in Brussels, EU energy ministers held emergency talks as the bloc considers a phasing out of Russian oil imports. Read about the day’s events as they unfolded on our liveblog. All times are Paris time (GMT+2).
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Outrage in Israel as Russia's Lavrov claims Hitler had Jewish roots
item.description: Israel lambasted Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Monday for claiming that Adolf Hitler was part Jewish, saying it was an "unforgivable" falsehood that debased the horrors of the Nazi Holocaust.
item.source: © Russian foreign ministry press service via AP
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: India and Germany pledge climate cooperation, differ over Ukraine war
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pledged 10 billion euros ($10.51 billion) to help India achieve its climate goals after meeting its Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Berlin on Monday, but the leaders remained far apart in their stance on the Ukraine war.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Russia thrown out of women's Euro, banned from European club football next season
item.description: UEFA has banned Russia from the Women's European Championship in July and from participating in qualifying for next year's World Cup following the country's invasion of Ukraine, European soccer's governing body said on Monday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Violence erupts in Paris as thousands of May Day protesters raise pressure on Macron
item.description: Police fired tear gas to push back black-clad anarchists who ransacked business premises in Paris on Sunday during May Day protests against the policies of newly re-elected President Emmanuel Macron.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: France: Low growth and inflation increase risk of stagflation
item.description: Income growth has stagnated as prices for essential goods and energy are on the rise. New figures from France’s National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (Insee) indicate that France could be entering a period of stagflation.
item.dc:creator: Grégoire SAUVAGE

item.title: 'Rape and wanton violence': Civilians in Andriivka recount Russian occupation
item.description: Civilians in Andriivka, a village about 60 kilometres west of Kyiv, are coming to terms with the devastation and trauma they suffered during the month they spent under Russian occupation.
item.dc:creator: Gulliver CRAGG

item.title: How pro-Israel Twitter accounts falsely claimed Palestinians staged photos of an injured child
item.description: Pro-Israel Twitter accounts started circulating a video showing a film crew recording a young actor lying on the ground, covered in blood, on April 24. They claimed the video offered proof that Palestinians were staging a photo to make it look like a Palestinian child had been injured. In reality, the Palestinian crew was filming a scene for “Empty Place”, a short film based on a true story.

item.title: Dozens of civilians evacuated from besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol
item.description: Roughly 100 civilians have been evacuated from a besieged steel plant in the eastern Ukrainian city of Mariupol, President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: UN chief calls on juntas in Burkina Faso, Guinea, Mali to hand power back to civilians
item.description: UN chief Antonio Guterres called Sunday for the military juntas in Burkina Faso, Guinea and Mali to ensure a swift return to civilian rule and reminded the world to deliver on "climate emergency" promises.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Qantas to launch non-stop flights from Sydney to London, New York
item.description: Qantas announced on Monday it will launch the world's longest non-stop commercial flight, with passengers set to spend 19 hours in the air traveling from Sydney to London by the end of 2025.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: May 1, International Workers’ Day: A brief history of resistance
item.description: France is expected to see massive May Day protests on Sunday as demonstrators on both sides of the political spectrum – but especially on the left – are expected to vent their anger over President Emmanuel Macron’s re-election. FRANCE 24 takes a look back at the history of May 1 as International Workers’ Day, a day of protests, parades and an annual challenge to the status quo.
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: UN confirms deal with Russia, Red Cross on evacuating civilians from Mariupol plant
item.description: The United Nations confirmed on Sunday that a deal on a "safe passage operation" had been agreed with Russian and Ukrainian officials as well as with the Red Cross on evacuating civilians trapped at the Azovstal steel plant in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol. Read our live blog below to see how the day's events unfolded. All times are Paris time [GMT+2].
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: US Speaker Pelosi meets Ukraine's Zelensky on unannounced visit to Kyiv
item.description: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday said she had met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv to send the message that the United States stands firmly with Ukraine as it battles "Putin's diabolic invasion."
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES
